author: Noah Buhayar
title: Houlihan Lokey Files for IPO, Led by BofA, Goldman Sachs
text:
Houlihan Lokey, the independent merger-advisory firm, filed for an initial public offering underwritten by banks led by Bank of America Corp. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc.
The firm, established in 1972, plans to list shares on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker HLI, the Los Angeles-based company said Friday in a regulatory filing.
Chief Executive Officer Scott Beiser has pursued growth through acquisitions as he prepared for an IPO. He announced a deal last month to buy MESA Securities to expand its entertainment and media business and purchased ArchPoint Partners, a technology-focused advisory firm, in 2014.
“We believe that the continuity of our senior leadership over an extended period of time has contributed to our differentiated business model,” the company said in the filing.
